intro: Cyclosorus tottus, commonly known as the Tottus water fern, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is native to freshwater environments in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in parts of Southeast Asia. The plant has a distinctive morphology, featuring four small, floating leaves that are often described as resembling a four-leaf clover. It thrives in still or slow-moving waters and is often found in ponds and wetlands. Cyclosorus tottus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
